section: TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The redaction of the term length and termination date creates an in-text contradiction. Without knowing the exact term, it's impossible to determine the agreement's duration or CONSULTANT's obligations. This omission of key details makes it hard to define obligations.

explanation: The redaction of the Mandatory Products creates an in-text contradiction. Without the definitions, the obligations surrounding exclusive use of product becomes ambiguous. This omission makes it difficult to enforce the requirement for CONSULTANT to exclusively use the MANDATORY PRODUCTS.

section: In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
explanation: The redaction of the minimum number of tournaments CONSULTANT has to play leads to ambiguity in text. It makes it impossible to tell the minimum amount of tournements the CONSULTANT has to play and is an in-text contradiction.
